title: If they're going to rename the Washington Redskins, these are the likeliest contenders
description: The Washington Redskins could be sporting a new team name this fall, if and when the 2020 NFL season begins.

title: Trump tweets disinformation on virus. See doctor's response
description: Dr. Jennifer Lee explains to CNN's Jim Sciutto why Trump is wrong to blame the rise on Covid-19 to increased testing.

title: Americans on private jet denied entry to Sardinia
description: Five Americans who flew by private jet to the Mediterranean island of Sardinia were refused entry to Italy on Wednesday due to new EU travel restrictions on countries with high coronavirus infection rates, police told CNN.

title: Jellyfish the size of dinner plates are invading US beaches this weekend
description: Some beaches in the northeastern United States are dealing with more than the threat of COVID-19 this holiday weekend. They have to contend with an unwelcome visitor: the Lion's Mane jellyfish.

title: Air France to cut more than 7,500 jobs
description: Air France plans to shed 7,580 jobs, or 17.5% of its current workforce, over the next few years, the company said on Friday.

title: Hillary Clinton on Trump's handling of the coronavirus: 'I would have done a better job'
description: Hillary Clinton taunted President Donald Trump in an interview published on Friday, criticizing his handling of the coronavirus by saying that she -- as president -- would have done a better job handling the international pandemic.

title: See how Canada crushed the curve while the US struggles
description: CNN'S Paula Newton explains what measures Canadians are taking to flatten the curve as countries continue to battle the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Iran struggles to explain fire at Natanz nuclear complex
description: Iran struggled to explain a fire that tore through the Iranian Natanz nuclear complex on Thursday morning, causing major damage to a site that has been key to the country's uranium enrichment program.

title: From Uganda to Nigeria, activists are calling on their governments to remove colonialists names from streets
description: Ternan Avenue, a long stretch of road named after British Col. Trevor Ternan lies beside the presidential state house in Uganda.

title: Brie Larson reveals some major roles she lost out on
description: Before she was "Captain Marvel," Brie Larson says she missed out on some big movies.

title: Turkey convicts human rights activists on terror charges
description: A Turkish court sentenced four Amnesty International activists to between two and six years in prison on terrorism charges in a high-profile trial Friday, which the human rights group described as a "travesty of justice of spectacular proportions."

title: Saudi consulate staff describe strange events on day of Khashoggi's death
description: Staff who worked at the Saudi consulate in Istanbul around the time of Jamal Khashoggi's murder told a court Friday that they were told to stay away from the residence on the day the dissident journalist went missing in 2018.

title: New airport design resembles shimmering desert mirage
description: A lavish new airport designed to look like a shimmering desert mirage has been unveiled as part of Saudi Arabia's multi-billion plan to reinvent itself as a major international tourism destination.

title: England unlocks travel with 59 countries -- but not the US
description: England has unlocked travel to and from 59 countries by lifting quarantine requirements, but visitors from the United States will still be subject to restrictions, the UK government said Friday.

title: Disgraced historian David Starkey is dropped by publisher over racist slavery comments
description: The British historian David Starkey has been dropped by his publisher and has resigned from an honorary position at a Cambridge University college after making racist remarks about slavery.

title: Mary Trump surfaces in written testimony as fight over publication of her book rages on
description: Mary Trump's attorneys are pressing a judge to fully clear her path to publish a bombshell book about dealings with her family, including her uncle President Donald Trump, claiming the confidential settlement she signed decades ago was based on fraudulent financial information.

title: France sends skulls of 24 independence fighters back to Algeria
description: France has returned the skulls of 24 Algerian resistance fighters who died while opposing French occupation of the North African nation in the 19th century.

title: Rocketing Covid-19 infections expose Trump's callous claim pandemic is 'handled'
Hong Kong protest leader Nathan Law flees as government warns calls for 'revolution' are now illegal
Singer Duffy slams Netflix over kidnap film '365 Days,' saying it 'glamorizes' sexual violence
description: Welsh singer Duffy, who revealed earlier this year that she had been kidnapped and raped, has written an open letter to Netflix, criticizing the streaming service for its decision to air the "erotic" kidnap film "365 Days."

title: 'Harry Potter' fan sites distance themselves from J.K. Rowling over gender identity comments
description: Two of the biggest "Harry Potter" fan websites have condemned author J.K. Rowling following her publication of a controversial essay on gender identity last month.

title: 'Towering' musical activist laid to rest after week of anger
description: At least 81 people are dead in Ethiopia in massive protests that erupted after the killing of singer and activist Hachalu Hundessa, local police commissioner told state media. CNN's Eleni Giokos reports.

title: Born on the dark fringes of the internet, QAnon is now infiltrating mainstream American life and politics
description: Since its origin three years ago, QAnon has festered in the darker corners of the internet. Now the group's followers, who call themselves "believers," have found a niche on social media and within the Republican Party.

title: Twitter may let you edit your tweets — but everyone needs to wear a mask first
How to celebrate a fun Fourth of July at home
A Russian billionaire wants to buy some of America's controversial statues
description: A Russian billionaire has offered to buy two controversial statues that protesters want removed from US cities due to their troubling ties to racism and colonialism.

title: What the Russian bounty leaks really say about the Trump administration
description: A version of this article first appeared in the "Reliable Sources" newsletter. You can sign up for free right here.

title: A wake-up call for the American dream
description: This fourth of July, nationwide protests and the Covid-19 crisis have forced America to recognize the ugly inequality lying just beneath its star-spangled surface.

title: Charts show the consequences for countries like US, Brazil and India who either never properly shut down or started reopening before cases fell
description:
• England unlocks travel with 59 countries -- but not the US
• What the world's biggest Covid-19 hospital looks like

title: How the hot dog became an American icon
description: No matter how you like your wiener prepared, grilled or boiled, with mustard, ketchup or chili, we can all agree on one thing, and that's that hot dogs have become part of a certain American cultural narrative.

title: It's National Hot Dog month, so here's a history lesson on the American icon
description: From Germany to Coney Island, here's a history lesson on the hot dog, an American icon

title: Broadway actor says he still has symptoms three months after testing positive for Covid-19
description: Adam Perry is still waiting for the day he can tap dance for eight minutes straight again. The Broadway actor and dancer tested positive for coronavirus about three months ago, but says he's still dealing with the after effects.

title: Saroj Khan, choreographer behind hundreds of Bollywood hits, dies aged 71
description: Saroj Khan, a celebrated Indian choreographer behind some of Bollywood's biggest productions, has died aged 71, her doctor has told CNN.

title: Serena Williams takes to the tennis court with daughter Olympia
description: Sorry Venus, Serena has found a new doubles partner.

title: WNBA star Maya Moore speaks of her 'relief' after helping a man overturn his prison sentence
description: WNBA star Maya Moore has spoken of her "relief" after successfully helping a man overturn his conviction when he he served 22 years in prison.

title: When a Black heavyweight boxer's victory terrified a US President
description: Global protests sparked by George Floyd's death at the hands of police in Minneapolis are likely never to be forgotten, but less well known are the race riots that flared across the US 110 years ago.

title: New crew will launch to the International Space Station in October
description: This October, NASA astronaut Kate Rubins and Russian cosmonauts Sergey Ryzhikov and Sergey Kud-Sverchkov will launch to the International Space Station from the Baikonur Cosmodrome in southern Kazakhstan.

title: Liverpool title-winning celebrations dampened after thrashing from Manchester City
description: Liverpool's title-winning celebrations were given a rude awakening as Jurgen Klopp's team was thrashed 4-0 by last year's champion Manchester City in the Premier League.

title: North Korea's Covid-19 response has been a 'shining success', Kim Jong Un claims
description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has praised what he described as his country's "shining success" in curbing the novel coronavirus pandemic, but warned his subordinates that lifting precautionary measures too early could be devastating.

title: The tragic allure of Alaska's 'Into the Wild' bus
description: Fairbanks Bus 142. Probably you've read about it, seen its replica on a movie screen, or recognize one of its headier nicknames.

title: British-Nigerian actress shines a light on colorism in Netflix documentary
description: To explore colorism in Africa, British-Nigerian actress Beverly Naya has produced a documentary on Netflix titled "Skin."

title: Singapore is on track to face its worst dengue outbreak in history
description: Singapore has just begun to get its second wave of coronavirus under control. Now, it's on track to face its worst-ever outbreak of another viral infection: dengue.

title: 30 years ago, he was wrongfully convicted of murder. Now police have apologized for forcing him to make a false confession
description: South Korean police have admitted using violence to extract a false confession from a man who spent 20 years in prison for the rape and murder of a 13-year-old.

title: What the world's biggest Covid-19 hospital looks like
description: India has opened what it says the biggest field hospital in the world for Covid-19, as the country's public health system is being tested by the surging numbers of coronavirus cases. CNN's Vedika Sud reports.

title: Study confirms new version of coronavirus spreads faster, but doesn't make people sicker
